start.text: {{emote|*Bright shies away from the light.*}} Ow, ow. Not so bright. What is it?
How can I help you, wanderer? Parts? Or do you need something fixed?
start.choice: You keep your workshop very dark. Why is that?

start.text: =name=! How lovely to see you. What can I do for you?
start.choice: Do you get along with Cat these days?

conversation.node: I understand. Let me know if you change your mind.

node.text: Well, I think of myself more of an artificer, but yes. I'm the tinker here, or at least I fill the role of one.
node.choice: What's the difference between a tinker and artificer?

node.text: {{emote|*Bright half-shrugs.*}} Nothing important.
I am, yes. I was not always, but I am now, and it's only gotten worse over time. Even a torch will hurt my eyes. There is a reason I keep my workshop dark.
I am sensitive to light. I was not always, but I am now, and it's only gotten worse over time. Even a torch will hurt my eyes. I would be grateful if you continue to cover your lights when you enter.
You may; just make sure you clean up. We keep it busy and we are not liable for any missing gems if you leave them there.
Just keeping the tools serviced, working on the power lines, the usual. That reminds me - are you looking for work right now?
node.choice: Maybe. What did you have in mind?

node.text: So, as you may have noticed, I have problems with light. I'm looking to fix that, and I need someone else to help me.
There is a certain type of liquid I've heard tell of. Very entropic. I've done some asking, and I think it may be of use to me. If you can get me a dram of it, I could test my theory.
node.choice: What kind of liquid am I looking for?

node.text: I've heard it called warm static. Dilute won't do; I'll need it in pure form. Just a dram should be enough. I'll compensate you for your work.
node.choice: Alright. I'll track down your static. Where should I start looking?
How will this help your problems with light?
I don't like the feeling of this. I'll pass, I'm afraid.

node.text: I'd prefer not go into detail on that just yet. Just rest assured that it won't cause any harm to anyone.

I happen to specialize in item modding. I like prototyping different designs, and I inscribe them onto disks myself. I'll be more than happy to help you learn a few mods; anything you have in mind, I can probably teach you.

Excellent! Thank you so much. I'm afraid I'm not actually wholly sure where to start, but I have a few ideas.
Warm static originates from the Moon Stair, but that's likely not a place you want to visit. The alchemist in Bethesda Susa is an expert in this sort of thing as well, but finding them is a journey in its own right. If you cannot find them, only then would I risk the Stair.
Should you be inclined to search at the source, you will be hunting a certain type of jell. Warm static of the purity I seek is supposedly harvested from its corpse, but you may need to dispatch several of them to find an appropriate sample - and if you use heat-based weapons, it would likely be destroyed outright.
Be cautious. I have heard stories. And when you do find the static, DO NOT do anything else with it. Bring it directly here.
node.choice: While I'm here, I had other questions.
I guess I'd better start looking. Live and drink.

node.text: A highly entropic liquid, called warm static. I believe it may be able to help me tolerate the light again. It originates from the Moon Stair, and if you have no other options, I believe you could source it from a certain type of ooze there. A much safer idea would be to find the alchemist, in Bethesda Susa. I only need a dram, but it needs to be pure - if it's dilute or otherwise contaminated, it won't work for my purposes.

{{emote|*Bright convulses on the ground. =pronouns.Possessive= arms warp and twist as though seen through dirty glass. =pronouns.Possessive= skin flickers, darkens, and flickers again. There is hissing, and something else - a thin keening alike to a dying animal, heard distantly on a cold wind.*}}
{{emote|*And then it stops, as quickly as it began. Eddies of static flicker about the tinker's body as =pronouns.possessive= skin shudders unsteadily with a warm glow. =pronouns.Subjective= unsteadily =verb:sit:afterpronoun= up.*}}

{{emote|*Bright is staring with a foolish grin.*}}
I could only imagine the risk, but it worked. It worked! My eyes don't hurt! My skin doesn't prickle! I...
=name=, words cannot describe what you have done for me. You have done me a favor I can never repay. I can teach you some of my designs, as I promised - I can only hope that will be enough. You are welcome at my door any time.
Thank you.

choice.text: You're welcome. Live and drink, Bright.

node.text:
Much better, thanks to you! I seem to have mostly lost my sense of pain, which is both a good and bad thing given my occupation. I also miss my arms, but I'm acclimating.
More than anything, though, I'm just so glad to be able to go outside again. I've missed it so badly.
node.choice: I'm glad to hear. Live and drink.

node.text: That's rather personal. I'm uncertain how disposed I am to open up to someone I don't know.

Cat and I used to... well. We were very close. She became much harder to talk to when she took on the mantle of warden. Eventually we fell out of touch. With how miserable I was in the light, I rarely ever interacted with her. I guess there was some resentment.
Now that I can go outside again, I see her a lot more. I like to believe that she's starting to warm up again; the other day she even laughed with me. It isn't much, but I'm thankful to be on talking terms with her again.
node.choice: Hopefully it works out. Live and drink.
